oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of graduates of Harding School, men with an airplane, President Coolidge fishing, the British King with an athlete, a motorboat racer, a man in a boat, racing diplomats, and three ads. Nashville Banner, 1931 July 26.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Gaither, Mary Elizabeth; Walsh, Annie B.; Anderson, Lillie Mae; Davis, Maurice; O'Brien, Wanda; Hunt, Bell; Percy, Vernie; Peercy, Sophia; Hunt, Mary Agnes; Magyar, Alexander; Endres, George; Coolidge, Calvin; Windsor V, King George; Jardine, D. Nashville Banner
Students; Airplanes; Pilots; Presidents; Fishing; Kings; Athletes; Boats; Diplomats
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of graduates of Harding School, men with an airplane, President Coolidge fishing, the British King shaking hands with a cricket player, an injured female motorboat racer smiling in bed with trophies, a man standing in a boat he built out of newspapers, five racing diplomats, and three ads. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.

oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
